title: FBI continues search for Michigan woman missing since December
description: The FBI is searching for Heather Mae Kelley who went missing last December. She told family she was going to meet someone in Kalamazoo and hasn't been seen since.

title: Jim Boeheim's long career at Syracuse ends, Autry takes over
description: Jim Boeheim’s 47-year tenure as coach at Syracuse ended Wednesday, with the university saying Orange assistant Adrian Autry has been promoted into the job

title: Biden administration weighs detaining migrant families, sparking Democratic blowback
description: The possible return to detaining migrants families quickly ignited political blowback from key members of President Joe Biden's party

title: Prosecutor won't charge 6-year-old accused of shooting teacher
description: A local prosecutor said Wednesday that he does not believe the law supports charging the 6-year-old boy accused of shooting a teacher at his Virginia elementary school.

title: Colorado police say no charges to be filed against Ja Morant
description: Police say Memphis Grizzlies guard Ja Morant won't face charges in Colorado related to the livestreamed video in which he appeared to be displaying a gun in a strip club

title: Nationwide shortage of asthma medication albuterol could worsen
description: Asthma medication albuterol has been facing a shortage since the fall -- and experts say it could get worse after a major supplier closed its facilities.

title: Alex Jones would get $520,000 salary under bankruptcy plan
description: Alex Jones’ company has proposed a plan in its bankruptcy case to pay the conspiracy theorist $520,000 a year, while leaving $7 million to $10 million annually to pay creditors, including relatives of the Sandy Hook school shooting victims

title: Chile: Attempted $32 million airport heist leaves two dead
description: An airport shootout in Chile’s capital has killed a security officer and an alleged robber in what authorities say was an attempted heist of more than $32 million in cash aboard a plane from Miami

title: Feds investigating fatal crash where Tesla plowed into parked firetruck
description: NHTSA has opened a special investigation into a fatal Tesla crash in California last month that will look at the vehicle's advanced driver assistance system.

title: What we know about the Americans kidnapped in Mexico
description: The two Americans who survived a kidnapping ordeal in Mexico are back in the U.S., as questions remain surrounding what happened to the two members of the group who died.

title: WATCH:  Little girl has adorable message for women
description: Three-year-old Aleksandra is celebrating the women in her life and around the world for International Women’s Day.

title: WATCH:  This cockatiel has ‘September’ stuck in his head and it’s adorable
description: Leo the cockatiel was caught on camera singing along to the iconic ‘Earth, Wind and Fire’ song while bouncing on his owner’s shoe.

title: TSA agents seize gun from actor Mike Epps in Indianapolis
description: Airport police say federal agents confiscated a loaded gun found in the hand luggage of actor and comedian Mike Epps, who was trying to board a flight at Indianapolis International Airport

title: Athletes sue Ivy League over its no-scholarship policy
description: A pair of basketball players from Brown are alleging in a federal lawsuit that the Ivy League’s policy of not offering athletic scholarships amounts to a price-fixing agreement that denies athletes proper financial aid and payment for their services

title: Biden budget aims to cut deficits nearly $3T over 10 years
description: President Joe Biden’s upcoming budget proposal aims to cut deficits by nearly $3 trillion over the next decade

title: Feds suspect Tesla using automated system in firetruck crash
description: U.S. investigators suspect that a Tesla was operating on an automated driving system when it crashed into a firetruck in California last month, killing the Tesla driver

title: 3 injured in fiery train derailment caused by rockslide
description: CSX Transportation says an empty coal train hit a rockslide along tracks in West Virginia, causing a fiery derailment that injured three crewmembers

title: House Republicans say they plan to visit Jan. 6 defendants in jail
description: Marjorie Taylor Greene said the Republicans' visit would focus on the conditions of those jailed over Jan. 6

title: Founder of Love's Travel Stops dies in Oklahoma at age 85
description: Love's Travel Stops and Country Stores says the founder of the convenience store chain known for its red and yellow heart logo, “Clean Places, Friendly Faces” motto, tractor-trailer maintenance and in-store showers has died

title: Louisville police engaged in pattern of unlawful and discriminatory conduct: DOJ
description: An investigation after Breonna Taylor's death found Louisville, Kentucky, police engaged in a pattern of unlawful, discriminatory conduct, the Justice Department said

title: FTC's new rule could end noncompete agreements for millions of workers
description: In a sweeping step earlier this year, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) proposed a rule that would void non-compete clauses and ban their use in future contracts.

title: Powell says 'no decision' on the Fed's next move on rates
description: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell stressed Wednesday that the central bank’s policymakers have yet to decide how large an interest rate hike to impose at its next meeting in two weeks in its drive to defeat high inflation

title: DOJ to review Memphis Police Department following Tyre Nichols' death
description: The Department of Justice is set to review the Memphis Police Department following Tyre Nichols death.

title: January US job openings dip, but still high at 10.8 million
description: U.S. employers posted 10.8 million job openings in January, indicating the American job market continues to run too hot for the inflation fighters at the Federal Reserve

title: Actor Nazanin Boniadi asks world to back Iran women protests
description: Actor Nazanin Boniadi is urging the world to back the protests in her native Iran calling for women’s rights and political change, saying despots fear nothing “more than a free and politically active woman.”

title: UN agency urges probe of schoolgirl poisonings in Iran
description: The U.N. cultural agency has expressed concern about the suspected poisoning of thousands of schoolgirls across Iran and called for investigations

title: Maker of unproven birth drug Makena to pull from US market
description: The maker of an unproven drug intended to prevent premature births says it will voluntarily remove the product from the United States

title: US investigates Tesla for steering wheels that can fall off
description: U.S. auto safety regulators have opened an investigation into Tesla’s Model Y SUV after getting two complaints that the steering wheels can come off while being driven

title: Flights suspended as Arctic air, snow and sleet blast UK
description: Dozens of flights have been suspended in the U.K. and some schools had to close as snow blanketed much of the country

title: Adidas earnings take beating on breakup with Ye, China slump
description: Adidas’ breakup with the rapper formerly known as Kanye West and the inability to sell his popular Yeezy line of shoes helped batter earnings at the end of last year

title: Germany cautious over Nord Stream pipeline attack reports
description: Germany’s defense minister has voiced caution over media reports that a pro-Ukraine group was involved in blowing up the Nord Stream gas pipelines in the Baltic Sea last year

title: FBI investigating ‘suspicious death’ of woman on Carnival cruise ship
description: The FBI is investigating a “suspicious death” of a female passenger aboard a Carnival cruise ship while it was en route to the Bahamas.

title: Trump could still be elected president if indicted or convicted, experts say
description: Former President Trump can still be elected president if indicted -- or even convicted -- in any of the state and federal probes he is facing, experts tell ABC News.

title: Trump loyalist Kash Patel's tax-exempt charity raises questions, experts say
description: Trump loyalist Kash Patel has been raising money for a charity he launched called "Fight With Kash" -- but some nonprofit experts say it could raise legal questions.

title: Hong Kong's Cathay posts $834 million loss for 2022
description: Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd

title: Hiker collapses and dies on rugged desert trail with no shade
description: A 64-year-old woman collapsed and died while hiking on an exposed and rugged desert trail in Texas, officials say.

title: 4 dead in plane crash over central Florida: Officials
description: Four people have died after two planes crashed over Lake Hartridge in Winter Haven, Florida, on Tuesday, law enforcement officials said.

title: Murdoch said Trump, Giuliani were 'increasingly mad' after election, documents show
description: Fox Corp. chairman Rupert Murdoch privately bashed Donald Trump and his attorney, Rudy Giuliani, following the 2020 election, according to newly released court records.

title: US to relax COVID testing rules for travelers from China
description: The Biden administration is preparing to relax COVID-19 testing restrictions for travelers from China as soon as Friday

title: WATCH:  Podcast interrupted when SUV slams into Houston cafe
description: These podcasters were recording in a Houston cafe when they were unexpectedly interrupted by an SUV that plowed into the window behind them.

title: Kevin McCarthy says he has no regrets about giving Tucker Carlson Jan. 6 footage
description: Kevin McCarthy is standing by his decision to grant Fox News host Tucker Carlson access to the raw security footage from Jan. 6

title: Man accused of attempting to open plane door allegedly tried to attack jail guards
description: A passenger accused of trying to open a plane emergency exit door and stabbing a flight attendant allegedly tried to attack two guards in jail on Tuesday, sources said.
